attributes.action: Enforce BBC rules of impartiality without the current left/liberal bias.
attributes.background: Brexit was a democratic majority not a "Populist" vote? Why is the US President so often denigrated for carrying out his manifesto? Why was I told the BBC had a right to "Editorial Licence" when reporting news from the Afghan War; we need facts not propaganda?

rejection.details:
The BBC is already required to deliver impartial news by the "Royal Charter for the continuance of the British Broadcasting Corporation" and the "Agreement Between Her Majesty’s Secretary of State for Culture, Media and Sport and the British Broadcasting Corporation". We're therefore not sure what further action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take. 

You can find out how to make a complaint here: 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/complaints/
